value.title: Protect your virtual machines by using Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Use Azure Backup to help protect the data for on-premises servers, virtual machines, virtualized workloads, SQL Server, Azure Files, and more.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 2: Describe core Azure services
value.excerpt: This learning path provides you with an introduction to the basics of Azure's core services for compute, network, storage, and database.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

topItems.title: Explore Azure compute services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different services that are available in Azure Compute.

topItems.title: Explore Azure Storage services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Deploy and configure Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll learn how to deploy and configure Azure IaaS Virtual Machine workloads. After completing the learning path, you’ll know how to plan, deploy, and upgrade Windows Server Azure Virtual Machines.

topItems.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

topItems.title: Customize Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine images
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to create new VMs from generalized images and use Azure Image Builder templates to create and manage images in Azure.

topItems.title: Automate the configuration of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to deploy Desired State Configuration (DSC) extensions, implement those extensions to remediate noncompliant servers, and use custom script extension.

topItems.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: Implement a Windows Server hybrid cloud infrastructure
value.excerpt: You will learn how to address problems relating to the migration of on-premises workloads into Azure. After completing the learning path, you will be able to implement a hybrid Azure infrastructure.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid network infrastructure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn to connect your on-premises environment to Azure, implement subnets and routing between your on-premises and cloud environments, and ensure that workloads in the cloud and on-premises perform DNS resolution to locate each other.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
topItems.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises Windows Server instances to Azure IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to plan a migration and select appropriate server migration tools. You will also learn how to use Azure Migrate, how to assess physical servers, and how to migrate those servers.

topItems.title: Implement a hybrid file server infrastructure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn to deploy Azure File Sync, migrate from DFS, and use Storage Migration Services to migrate file servers to Azure.

value.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
value.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

value.title: Explore Azure Storage services
value.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Create an Azure Cognitive Search solution
value.excerpt: Unlock the hidden insights in your data with Azure Cognitive Search.

value.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

value.title: Create a knowledge store with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Learn how to persist the output from an Azure Cognitive Search enrichment pipeline for independent analysis or downstream processing.

value.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to handle infrastructure and service failure, recover from the loss if data, and recover from a disaster by designing availability and recoverability into your architecture.

images.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
Design for availability and recoverability in Azure

value.title: Extend your on-premises file share capacity using Azure File Sync
value.excerpt: Evaluate and deploy Azure File Sync to extend the capacity of your on-premises file share.

value.title: Implement a hybrid file server infrastructure
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn to deploy Azure File Sync, migrate from DFS, and use Storage Migration Services to migrate file servers to Azure.

value.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

value.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
value.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: Cloud storage
value.excerpt:
Gain a deep understanding of data and how it's stored on the cloud.
In this learning path, you will:

Get an overview of data and how it can be stored
Read case studies of how data is stored in distributed file systems
Learn from case studes of how NoSQL databases and cloud object storage works

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Cloud storage overview
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn all about data and get an overview of how it's stored, including local and distributed file systems, databases, and object storage.

topItems.title: Case studies: Distributed file systems
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover how distributed file systems work, then learn about Hadoop and Ceph.

topItems.title: Case studies: NoSQL databases and cloud object storage
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about two more types of storage - NoSQL databases and object storage - with case studies from industry.

value.title: Access Metrics from your Azure Blob Storage Containers Programmatically
value.excerpt: Discover how to use Azure Monitor to gather performance metrics and then configure and access those metrics from .NET application code.

value.title: Case studies: NoSQL databases and cloud object storage
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about two more types of storage - NoSQL databases and object storage - with case studies from industry.

value.title: Cloud storage overview
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn all about data and get an overview of how it's stored, including local and distributed file systems, databases, and object storage.

value.title: Storage and network virtualization
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how storage and network resources can be virtualized to support software defined datacenters.

value.title: Control access to Azure Storage with shared access signatures
value.excerpt: Grant access to data stored in your Azure Storage accounts securely through the use of shared access signatures.

value.title: Gather metrics from your Azure Blob Storage containers
value.excerpt: Find out how to use Azure Storage Analytics to track the performance of your Blob storage containers and to display that Blob performance in your dashboard.

value.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
value.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Organize Azure storage blobs with properties and metadata
value.excerpt: Find out about Azure storage blob properties and metadata, how to organize blob data, and create an app with ASP.NET to retrieve metadata.

value.title: Support concurrency in Blob storage apps with ETags and blob leases
value.excerpt: In this module you will learn how to implement application code to manage concurrency in blob storage.

value.title: Design your site recovery solution in Azure
value.excerpt: Protect your applications and data from disasters with a well-designed site recovery solution.

value.title: Optimize storage performance and costs using Blob storage tiers
value.excerpt: Learn what the different storage tiers are for blob storage and how they can improve performance and reduce costs.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Set up CORS for your website and storage assets
value.excerpt: Set up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for your Azure website and storage assets in order to allow cross-domain access to your resources.

value.title: Explore data storage and processing in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore data storage and processing in Azure

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: Copy and move blobs from one container or storage account to another from the command line and in code
value.excerpt: Learn how to utilize .NET Storage Client library, AzCopy, and Azure CLI utilities to copy and move blobs between contains and storage accounts both synchronously and asynchronously.
